item.title: I don't like traveling anymore ¬∑ Sid Verma
item.description: One of my biggest motivators to make money in my early 20s was traveling. I would book one way tickets to places near and far, enjoy the nature, the food, the culture, and the lovely people. I would come back a slightly wiser, friendlier and a happier person.

item.title: Bumps In the Gumroad
item.description: It‚Äôs hard to overstate just how much my opinion on Gumroad has changed since the beginning of 2025. I‚Äôm not mad, just disappointed. Incredibly disappointed. Strike One: Unintended Consequences Let me preface this by saying I get problems with email delivery. There‚Äôs a whole system of checks and ranking that is based almost entirely on reputation. And it goes layers deep: bad behavior by one entity can risk the reputation of a provider serving thousands of people.

item.title: Things I learned rewriting a project from scratch
item.description: Around two years ago I wrote about a project I have been working on and off for a few years. In that post I explain how and why I decided to rewrite it from scracth, splitting it in multiple parts. I ended up not following exactly the plan that I laid out, and I also worked on the rewrite more slowly than I wanted. But rewriting from scratch allowed me to experiment with new ideas and discover new tricks, and after two years I learned enough stuff that I can make a blog post about it!

item.title: Trip To China
item.description: Everyday life Life here feels way easier. Paying, ordering, getting around‚Äîeverything‚Äôs smooth and efficient. Technology is more advanced and more integrated. The quality of service is on another level. Workers are more involved and friendly, which makes daily life way more pleasant. You can find any type of services, like someone waiting for you at a restaurant, sending an item for you.. You can received products in 20 min. Cities are a bit less walkable, some big ones are massive, and it can feel overwhelming at times. The food is so fxcking great, super diverse, and cheap. Tourism is also built mainly for Chinese people, which makes it fascinating to experience from the outside. They build so much infrastructure for Chinese tourism‚Äîsometimes it can be weird because you find empty villages, shopping malls, hotels‚Ä¶ People don‚Äôt really talk politics unless they‚Äôre very close. What stands out most is how safe it feels. You can leave your bag in public and it‚Äôll still be there, maybe not in nightclubs tho. As a girl, being able to walk at night without fear is priceless. The worst thing you can experience at a party is being too drunk. There are no drugs. I haven‚Äôt seen homeless people either. Streets are clean.

item.title: Legacy Software is Good
item.description: People have to stop throwing the word ‚Äúlegacy‚Äù around as a pejorative for things that are more than 5 years old. Software that can stand the test of time is rare, and should be celebrated.

item.title: Continuous integration ‚â† Continuous delivery
item.description: Discover why separating CI from CD using cloud platforms like AWS or Google Cloud enhances security and efficiency in your software delivery pipeline.

item.title: How to Replace LeetCode with Something That Actually Works
item.description: Recently there has been an interest in cheating(?) leetcode style interviews(Yang 2025). These articles highlight a longstanding issue in tech recruiting: puzzle-style assessments have little to no correlation with actual job performance(Konnikova 2013; McAllister 2013), and leetcode is nothing but algorithmic puzzles. This makes them a poor predictor of job performance. What leetcode does predict seems to be success at leetcode style interviews(Mroczka 2024). Go figure. If you are in power to stop doing these silly things and reach for something with actual evidence of working, here is a blueprint for performing a structured interview with a focus on programmers, but that can be adapted for other positions quite easily.

item.title: to do nothing
item.description: On a rainy Saturday in Montreal, I sat alone with my thoughts‚Äîuntil I realized they weren‚Äôt me. I call them Becky, and she never stops talking.

item.title: What If We Made Advertising Illegal?
item.description: What if we banned all advertising? Not regulate it‚Äîabolish it. This proposal would transform manipulation machines, and maybe save democracy itself. A thought experiment worth considering.

item.title: Laurent Kemp√© - SSE-Powered MCP Server with C# and .NET in 15.7MB executable
item.description: Now that we‚Äôve explored how to leverage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to utilize external Tools and AI models in C# applications, how to write your own Standard Input/Output (STDIO) MCP server in C# using the modelcontextprotocol / csharp-sdk, and how we can dockerize your .NET C# MCP server to be able to distribute it for use by AI clients. It‚Äôs time to take a step further and explore how to leverage Server-Sent Events (SSE) MCP servers so that we can deploy them remotely, for example on a Raspberry Pi.

item.title: One on Ones: What The HECK Do You Talk About? - Engineering Manager AMA
item.description:
So you have regular one on ones with your manager -- that's a good start! But are you stuck in a status update infinite loop?
Let's break out and focus on different things you can use your one on one time for as a software developer.
As with all livestreams, I'm looking forward to answering YOUR questions! So join me live and ask in the chat, or you can comment now and I can try to get it answered while I stream.
